title: Dumbo Notices Something's Different
theme: Everyone has something they care about
plot_outline: Dumbo's carefully constructed solitude is disrupted when they're forced to interact with a former friend who's gotten their life together. As vice leads to bigger problems, both characters must confront their issues with trust, intimacy, and the fact that everyone has something they care about.

scenes.title: Rock Bottom Has a Basement
scenes.action: Dumbo begins their day with the usual routine of avoiding responsibility and managing expectations. The catalyst for today's adventure presents itself in the form of a knock at the door. Despite every instinct screaming "don't get involved," circumstances and poor judgment combine to draw Dumbo into the situation.

dialogue.speaker: Patty LaHam
dialogue.line: Why do I always get involved in these situations?
dialogue.subtext: terrified of being vulnerable again

dialogue.speaker: Dumbo
dialogue.line: This is getting complicated, and I don't do complicated.
dialogue.tone: defeated resignation with occasional flashes of frustrated energy
dialogue.subtext: secretly hoping someone will save them

dialogue.speaker: Dumbo
dialogue.line: Tomorrow I'm not answering the door.
dialogue.tone: defeated resignation with occasional flashes of frustrated energy
dialogue.subtext: protecting themselves from further disappointment

visual_details.setting_description: Where dignity comes to die and rent checks bounce higher than expectations

character_appearances.Dumbo: droopy, bloodshot, crusty pizza slice, stained remote control, empty beer cans, showing signs of recent poor decisions
character_appearances.Patty LaHam: undefined, rhinestone tiara, fake eyelashes, flask of gin, showing signs of spiritual emptiness
character_appearances.Mickey the Dealer: Tired, worn down, but still clinging to whatever dignity remains

visual_details.environmental_details: Peeling paint, broken promises, and the smell of desperation
visual_details.mood_lighting: Harsh fluorescent reality cutting through last night's delusions

scenes.title: The Situation Deteriorates
scenes.action: Dumbo's past comes back to haunt them when a former relationship becomes relevant to current events.

dialogue.speaker: Patty LaHam
dialogue.line: Well, this should be interesting.
dialogue.subtext: revealing more about their pain than intended

dialogue.speaker: Dumbo
dialogue.line: Can we solve this with minimal effort on my part?
dialogue.tone: defeated resignation with occasional flashes of frustrated energy
dialogue.subtext: testing whether this person can be trusted

dialogue.speaker: Patty LaHam
dialogue.line: Why does this always happen?
dialogue.subtext: desperately wants to be proven wrong about people

scenes.title: When Bad Gets Worse
scenes.action: The situation escalates when their reputation precedes them. What seemed like a manageable problem reveals itself to be connected to larger issues involving corporate greed. Dumbo realizes they're in deeper than anticipated and that their usual strategy of "ignore it and hope it goes away" won't work this time.

dialogue.speaker: Patty LaHam
dialogue.line: Well, this should be interesting.
dialogue.subtext: terrified of being vulnerable again

dialogue.speaker: Mickey the Dealer
dialogue.line: Things just keep getting worse.
dialogue.subtext: revealing more about their pain than intended

dialogue.speaker: Mickey the Dealer
dialogue.line: At least it's over.
dialogue.subtext: revealing more about their pain than intended

scenes.title: Same Shit, Different Day
scenes.action: The episode concludes with Dumbo having learned nothing from their experience but somehow finding themselves in a slightly different variation of the same situation they started in. Victory is redefined as "not making things significantly worse," and the audience is reminded that some problems don't get solved—they just get replaced with new problems.

dialogue.speaker: Dumbo
dialogue.line: Can we just pretend this is someone else's problem?
dialogue.tone: defeated resignation with occasional flashes of frustrated energy
dialogue.subtext: secretly hoping someone will save them

dialogue.speaker: Mickey the Dealer
dialogue.line: Why does this always happen?
dialogue.subtext: protecting themselves from further disappointment

dialogue.speaker: Dumbo
dialogue.line: I need a pizza and a nap, in that order.
dialogue.tone: defeated resignation with occasional flashes of frustrated energy
dialogue.subtext: protecting themselves from further disappointment
